title: ASL 1.2 — Greetings & Introductions
objectives: Use common greetings in ASL (HELLO, HI, GOOD-BYE).
Introduce yourself with NAME and NICE-TO-MEET-YOU.
Apply basic non-manual markers (NMM) for questions.

vocab.def: A common greeting, flat hand at forehead moving outward.
Two fingers tapping each other in an X-shape.
Flat hands brush once, index fingers meet.

sections.heading: Greetings in Context
sections.body: Learn how to say HELLO and GOOD-BYE in different contexts (formal/informal).

sections.heading: Self-Introduction
sections.body: Practice signing NAME + YOUR-NAME-WHAT. Respond with NAME + fingerspelling.

sections.heading: Role Play
sections.body: Pair up: introduce yourself to a partner and respond appropriately.

sections.heading: NMM for Questions
sections.body: Practice raising eyebrows for Yes/No questions and furrowing brows for WH-questions.

items.q: Which NMM is used for Yes/No questions?
Gloss the phrase 'What’s your name?' in ASL.

items.prompt: How confident are you in introducing yourself in ASL? What can you practice more?

reflectionPrompt: Record a short video of yourself introducing your name and greeting someone.
summary: You can now use common greetings, introduce yourself, and apply correct NMM for questions.
